item.description:
The former Moseley family estate on the Merrimack River, this park features 19th century gardens and plantings, rolling meadows, towering pines, and one of the largest naturally-occurring stands of mountain laurel in Massachusetts. Most breathtaking are the ornamental trees and masses of azaleas and rhododendrons that bloom in May and June. An exquisite place for walking, biking, horseback riding and informal picnics. Special Use Permits may be obtained for wedding ceremonies and similar programs.

If you need a ride please say so in your rsvp, saying which area you are in.

Meet in the parking area at 10:30. The Parking Fee at Maudslay State Park is $2.00.

Directions to the park:
Take Rte. 95, exit 57 to Rte. 113 West for 1/4 mile and turn right on Gypsy Lane and go another 1/4 mile. The main entrance and parking area are at the intersection of Gypsy Lane and Curzon Mill/Pine Hill.

http://www.mass.gov/d...

Lunch afterwards in Newburyport at the Black Cow. (I have a reservation for 10 people.)
54R Merrimac St.
978-499-8811

http://www.blackcowre...

Directions to the restaurant:
From Route 128 (95) take Exit 57 (Newburyport Rt. 113). Follow Rt. 113 East for 2.5 miles. At the set of lights take a left on Green Street. At the bottom of Green Street, stay in the right hand lane and cross over Merrimac Street in to the parking lot.
item.name: Maudsley State Park
